description: From opprobrō (“reproach, taunt”)  +‎ -ate, from ob (“against”) + probrum (“disgrace, dishonor”).

adjectives.description: opprobriate (comparative more opprobriate, superlative most opprobriate)

verbs.description: opprobriate (third-person singular simple present opprobriates, present participle opprobriating, simple past and past participle opprobriated)

entries.meaning: To express opprobrium for or to view with opprobrium; to scorn.
